page.title: 06St. George's Church
page.content: St. George's Church at Reforne was founded in 1754 and consecrated in 1766. Thomas Gilbert built this domed church of local Portland stone using money from the Stone Grant Fund and a contribution of Â£500 from King George III. Only 30 years after the church was completed a storm in November 1795 caused such extensive damage that a new roof was needed. This time George III donated Â£200. The cemetary was often waterlogged, so in 1788 the locals had to dig a ditch round it. The 1851 census shows that, in order to raise funds, 622 of the 642 pews were private property. Today the church has been carefully restored and maintained by local people and, although not used for regular worship, it is open to the public and is popular with tourists in the Summer. Liz Bartlett
